alert.note: Alert for GUC100; GUC110; GUC120; Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 22 at 4:54PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: RESENT TO CORRECT EXPIRATION TIME ...HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE OVER THE WEEKEND INTO NEXT WEEK... A monsoon trough is currently north of the Marianas with a tropical disturbance, JTWC Invest 90W, centered northeast of the Marianas near 19N152E, currently drifting southwest. 90W has the potential to strengthen over the next few days. If this does occur, 90W could help to bolster the moisture inflow as a monsoon surge pushes into the region. from the southwest to induce locally heavy rainfall over the Marianas. The greatest potential of flooding will be over Guam, though there is a possibility of flooding for the CNMI. This situation will be monitored closely over the coming days. If the potential for heavy rainfall continues, this outlook will be updated. However, if the potential diminishes, the outlook will be allowed to expire. For the latest Marianas forecast, visit our website at weather. gov/gum/
